title: Think-Aloud-Based Diagnostic Reasoning Education for Radiological Image Interpretation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Terminology and Knowledge of Human Anatomy
context.additional_context: Project-based digital environment training to enhance radiographic image interpretation skills. Acquiring expert-level thinking processes through team case analysis and iterative feedback

learning_goals: Learners can consciously utilize four cognitive processes—Gestalt interpretation, goal-directed search, rule application, and prior case reasoning—when analyzing suspected fracture cases in radiographic images.
Learners can verbalize and share their diagnostic reasoning processes with peers/instructors through think-aloud protocols.
Learners can selectively apply different interpretation strategies (Gestalt vs. goal-directed search) based on abnormal/normal imaging cases.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
